descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value:
This course is the third and final course in general chemistry, the continuation of CHEM 101 and CHEM 102. Topics covered include equilibria in aqueous solutions: acid-base, complex ions, solubility equilibria; electrochemistry and oxidation-reduction reactions; chemical kinetics; descriptive chemistry: representative elements and industrial processes; coordination chemistry; introduction to organic and biomolecules; special topics.

This course will have a recitation/discussion section meeting on Saturdays from 12-1pm, immediately following the chemistry lab CHEM 123-CN.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value: Grade of C- or higher in CHEM 102 or equivalent course, or consent of instructor. Students must enroll in CHEM 123 (lab), and the associated discussion section.
